text: <@U3T21PDBK> what never worked for you? Adding custom fonts to the theme? I had trouble as well and finally got it after searching through this slack.
at one point i followed that KB article to the t and nothing worked. Even did it in a fresh hs boilerplate theme

it goes like this
1. import font via google @import. inside _typography.css (or whatever method you want)
2. create "*fonts*" folder in root folder of your theme
3. create folders in there with your font name
4. create *font.json* in each folder
5. structure your *font.json* like in the article
6. to go your theme.json and add in `"custom_fonts": [ "./fonts/Montserrat", ".fonts/Dosis", ".fonts/Allura", ".fonts/Raleway" ]`
once you're done you should be able to go to any page editor and add a rich text block. you chould see your custom fonts in the font picker.
